column4: The update manager before beginning to update shows low memory. Why is it such? (I am on dual booted 10.04 LTS)
what is the exact error message? need more details
After clicking install updates, window pops up showing "not enough disk space" "empty some disk space"
pastebin the output of       df -h
http://pastebin.com/PERZxXyV
you have ~90MB available it seems...you need to free up space, or expand your partition
how difficult is it to expand the partition?
well, i would boot into a live cd, and use gparted to expand the partition...depending on how many partitions/operating systems you have, it can be very easy to quite time consuming
i have a live cd of 9.x. my other partition is xp via wubi.
then you can probably shrink the xp partition (defrag first) and expand the ubuntu partition
Jordan_U the gparted documentation recommends it http://gparted.sourceforge.net/display-doc.php?name=help-manual&lang=C#gparted-advanced-partition-actions  besides, it won't hurt any to do so
for how long can i go without updating ubuntu?
lol some people run very old systems and never update...depends on how comfortable you are with potential security holes
example, if you have a "work horse" machine that maybe only encodes video 24/7 or renders 3d sequences, never has a need to connect to the net..you can run this system indefinitely without updating
so its ok if i delay this a bit
bleachbit for linux, ccleaner for windows
apt-get install bleachbit?
will it give problems when installing modules to other partitions?
yes, but you only have about 6 gig for your entire linux installation.  please consider shrinking windows, and expanding linux partition by 20 or more GB
i don't know..what do you mean by modlues?
like checking out from a repository.
